why_choose: Why choose this course? To build a career in English Language Teaching/Instruction To be a globally certified TESOL trainer and examiner To pursue diverse career paths including AI, digital language analytics & more.
what_learn: What you will learn? English Language Teaching/Instruction - Gain advanced linguistic competence, language teaching expertise, and Trinity CertTESOL certification, preparing you for English language teaching/instruction roles. Content Development - Acquire material and curriculum development skills, creative and applied linguistics, and literature-based language pedagogy. Language Data Analysis - Develop sociocultural and pragmatic competence and research and analytical skills in linguistics. Language Assessment - Advance your career in Language Assessment, Consulting and Language Policy Advisor roles. Language and Technology - Stay ahead in technology-enhanced language teaching, integrating AI, data analysis, prompt engineering and digital tools, and developing digital literacy and archiving skills. Media and Language - Develop multimodal communication skills, harnessing the power of media in language teaching, including writing for media, image generation, creating videos and podcasts, and managing social media. Research - Advance your career with research expertise, complete a dissertation and independent research project, and prepare for research-oriented careers. Managerial Roles  - Develop professional development and critical thinking skills, preparing you for managerial roles in language education.
modules: Modules English Phonology and Morphology Introduction to Syntax and Semantics Teaching English as a Second Language Research in Applied Linguistics Year 1 Task-based Language Teaching Language Acquisition Pragmatics in the Digital Age Research methods in TESOL Trinity College CertTESOL Sociolinguistics Technology in Second Language Teaching Corpus Linguistics Natural Language processing E-Learning Content Development Multimodal Curriculum Design Year 2 Teaching Literature in ESL Classroom AI Prompting Skills for Professional Excellence Psycholinguistics Dissertation Digital Archiving Educational Technology Online Teaching Methods Text Mining Critical Thinking Skills for Evaluating AI-Generated Contents The Art of Subtitling
career: Career prospects Teaching - Graduates can pursue teaching roles such as English Language Teaching, International TESOL Instruction, Online Language Tutoring, Specialist Language Teaching, and Corporate Language Training. Content Development - Graduates can develop content as Curriculum Designers, Educational/E-Learning Content Developers, Instructional Designers and Translators. Language Data Analysis - Other career paths include, and Linguistic Consultant. Language Assessment Specialisation - Graduates can specialise in  Language Assessment and pursue the role of Language Education Policy Advisor Educational Technology - Graduates can explore technology-related roles such as EdTech Specialist, AI-Language Specialist and Educational Technology Entrepreneur. Media - Media-related careers, such as Prompt Engineering, Subtitling, Copy Editing, and Proofreading, are also within reach. Research - Graduates can pursue research-oriented careers as Linguistics and Language Researchers or Doctoral Candidates. Managerial Roles - Graduates can take on managerial roles like Online Course Facilitator/Manager and Global Language Programme Director.
